title: Details revealed about King Charles III's coronation service
description: The coronation service for King Charles III will be one of many faiths and many languages

title: King Charles III coronation will recognize ‘people of all faiths’
description: In a remarkable twist, the coronation will acknowledge that Britain is no longer an exclusively Christian country.

title: Key nations sit out U.S. standoff with Russia, China, leaks show
description: THE DISCORD LEAKS | Documents illustrate how emerging nations' bid to duck Washington's showdown with Moscow and Beijing have put Biden's global agenda at risk.

title: Mexico's ruling party sweeps mine reform, other bills to law
description: Mexico’s Senate has approved a wide-ranging reform of laws governing the mining industry, including a requirement that companies pay 5% of profits to local communities

title: Israelis rally for 17th week against judicial overhaul plans
description: Tens of thousands of Israelis are protesting judicial overhaul proposals in the 17th weekly rally against Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s governing coalition

title: U.S. evacuation convoy reaches Sudanese port city, State Department says
description: The United States paid for more than a dozen local buses to carry U.S. citizens from the capital, Khartoum, to Port Sudan on the Red Sea, officials said.

title: Life-size sculpture of euthanized walrus unveiled in Norway
description: A walrus that became a global celebrity last year after it was seen frolicking and basking in a Oslo fjord before it was euthanized by the authorities has been honored with a bronze sculpture in Norway

title: Buckingham Palace: coronation backdrop, tourist attraction, unloved home
description: King Charles III has told friends and government officials he intends to stay at Clarence House rather than moving to the palace.

title: Zoo seeks ‘outgoing’ worker to wear big bird costume and scare seagulls
description: Blackpool Zoo in Britain wants to hire workers as a “seagull deterrent” to stop the birds stealing visitors’ food — by wearing an eagle suit and chasing them away when required.

title: As battle for Sudan continues, civilian deaths top 400
description: Gunfire and heavy artillery fire has persisted in parts of Sudan’s capital Khartoum, residents said, despite the extension of a cease-fire between the country’s two top generals, whose battle for power has killed hundreds and sent thousands fleeing for their lives

title: Pope visits refugees, urges Hungary to show charity to all
description: Pope Francis has thanked Hungarians for welcoming Ukrainian refugees and urged them to help anyone in need

title: As fentanyl crisis grows, U.S.-Mexico divide deepens
description: Mexico's president denies the opioid is produced in his country. U.S. Republicans want to send troops across the border to attack the labs.

title: Ukraine live briefing: At least 25 dead from Russian strikes
description: A mother and child were killed in Dnipro while at least 23 other people died in Uman following the Kremlin's deadliest attacks on civilians since the winter.
